name: RYANAIR Boeing 737-800 Trip Report - Liverpool (John Lennon) to Dublin
description:

Date of Travel: AUGUST 2017
Airline: Ryanair
Aircraft: Boeing 737-800
Livery: Ryanair standard   
Route: LPL-DUB
Tail number: EI-FRP
Miles: 141
Airborne time: 0h41m
Notes: New Ryanair cabin

Thanks for finding my video and pressing play! 

So Ryanair aren‚Äôt anyone‚Äôs favourite airline right now. But I‚Äôve always liked them. This trip cost me under EIGHT POUNDS - ¬£4.99 for the flight and ¬£3.00 seat selection. No bags needed as this was a short trip. You really cannot beat that value. 

This is my first report from Liverpool John Lennon Airport and it was my first visit in ten years. It was good to be back. Liverpool is a simple and efficient regional airport with a decent lounge considering it caters exclusively to low cost airlines and charter carriers. 

It remains to be seen whether Ryanair will recover from their current situation. But even so, this trip is a reminder that I‚Äôm very lucky to live in Europe. If you really want to fly cheap, you can - and it‚Äôs fine. (But seriously, put a seat pocket in PLEASE Ryanair! That‚Äôs all I ask!)

Enjoy the report. 

Do you have any ideas for future trip reports? Something you've never seen on YouTube before? Why not suggest it to me in the comments? I read every single one! üëçüèª

Enjoy the video, and thanks for watching. If you subscribe, then thanks for being part of the channel!
